explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test method applicable to liquid substances are not available (test temperature: 140degC).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing chlorine and oxygen (but not fluorine), with the chlorine and oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 2,200mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of >4,000mg/kg, together with the absence of mortality at the highest dose of 4000mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a liquid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Although no deaths were observed in rats receiving an inhalation dose of 1.75mg/L, there are no test data available for higher doses (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: In rabbit skin irritation tests, the treated animals exhibited a Draize score of 0.34 at 24 hours, but the effects disappeared by 48 hours (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on no evidence of irritation observed in rabbit eye irritation studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)).

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Category 1
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: Based on positive results in guinea pig skin sensitization tests employing the Optimization test method (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data in in vitro reverse mutation tests and in vivo micronucleus tests on mouse bone marrow cells (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)), though in vitro chromosome aberration tests showed positive.

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was no evidence of treatment-related incidence of tumor formation observed in 104-week carcinogenicity studies in rats and mice (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)). Also due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category C by EPA (1993).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on reproduction or offspring development observed in rat 2-generation reproduction studies and rat/rabbit teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: No toxic symptoms or signs referable to specific target organs were observed in the available animal studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986)).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: No toxic symptoms or signs referable to specific target organs were observed at dose levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2 in the available subacute toxicity studies in rats (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2004)).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 72 hours EbC50=0.1mg/L of the algae (Green Algae) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2004).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (log Kow=3.13(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), since there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), it was classified into Category 1.
